input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Polycystic ovary syndrome

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 28 YEARS OLD AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS FEMALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Irregular periods and heavy bleeding
- Excess hair growth on your face and body (hirsutism)
- Acne on your face and back
- Weight gain over the past few months
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION about six months ago, with your periods becoming more irregular and unpredictable. The hair growth started gradually around your jawline and chin, and your acne has worsened, especially on your cheeks and back. You’ve noticed you’re gaining weight even though your diet hasn’t changed much. You’re worried because your mother has mentioned similar issues in her youth, and you’ve read about PCOS being common in women with family history. You feel a bit self-conscious about the facial hair and acne, and you're concerned about your fertility and overall health.
output:
THINKING: I need to explain my symptoms clearly but I’m also feeling a bit overwhelmed and worried about how long it’s been going on. I want to mention all my concerns, especially about the weight and hair, but
ANSWER: Well, I’m not really sure how long it’s been, maybe around six months or so, but my periods have been all over the place—kind of irregular and heavy sometimes. I also started growing more hair on my face and body, especially around my jawline and chin, and my skin is breaking out more than it used to, like on my cheeks and back. I’ve been gaining weight too, even though I haven’t really changed what I eat. My mom had some problems like this when she was young, and I read it might be related. I guess I’m just worried about what’s going on with my body and if it’s okay for me to have all this happen.
